english: hall; main room; reception hall; auditorium

etymology.description: phonetic 尚 + semantic 土; component 向 depicts a house
etymology.interpretation: Meaning is anchored by 土, suggesting earth, ground, and constructed space, while 尚 supplies the sound. The presence of 向 as a house-like element reinforces the idea of an interior building space used as a hall.

examples.chinese: 我们在礼堂集合(我們在禮堂集合)。
中午去食堂吃饭(中午去食堂吃飯)，菜很实惠(菜很實惠)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngwǔ qù shítáng chīfàn, cài hěn shíhuì.
examples.english: At noon we go to the canteen to eat; the dishes are affordable.

examples.chinese: 校长在大堂发表讲话(校長在大堂發表講話)。
examples.english: The principal gave a speech in the main hall.
